sentence.Network_cn: 我对那些限制感到很烦。

sentence.Network_en: She desired a fixed occupation - no matter how onerous, how irksome.
sentence.Network_cn: 她希望有个固定的职业,不管这个职业多么繁重, 多么令人厌倦.

sentence.Network_en: And then all ties were irksome, all earthly attachments unnecessary.
sentence.Network_cn: 于是,一切联系都是讨厌的, 所有尘世的依附都无必要了.

list.abs: And then all ties were irksome , all earthly attachments unnecessary ., 于是 , 一切联系都是讨厌的 , 所有尘世的依附都无必要了.
She always speaks irksome complaints ., 她总是发出令人厌烦的牢骚.
say it as if you can remember little else-certainly not whatever irksome matter you were just discussing .好像是你只能再想起少许事情--当然不是刚才讨论的不论什么让你烦恼的事情。
It was too irksome to lie there , harassing my brain with a hundred idle misgivings ., 躺在那儿是太烦神了 , 有一百种没根据的忧虑困扰着我的头脑.

entry.tran: 令人恼怒的;令人厌烦的;令人烦恼的
entry.def: If something is irksome, it irritates or annoys you.

means.word_mean: 1. so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness;

sentences.sentence: "the deadening effect of some routine tasks"
"a ho-hum speaker who couldn't capture their attention"
"what an irksome task the writing of long letters is"- Edmund Burke
"the tiresome chirping of a cricket"- Mark Twain
